result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Levi W Geisness
Current: 12400 W Beloit Rd., #1, New Berlin, WI 53151 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2022)
Prior: Unknown,

ADDRESS INFO for Levi W Geisness
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 10-27-2022)
Prior: 12400 W Beloit Road, New Berlin, WI 53151 United States

addressed to: Levi W Geisness for hearing on November 17, 2022
Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward.
Hearing on November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 10/17/2022: Defendant to have no contact with victim D or witness E listed in the Amended Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 

PREVIOULSY ISSUED CONDITIONS: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol, with the exception of possession of alcohol while at his work location.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

8:58 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Levi W Geisness in court.  Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden in court for Levi W Geisness.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter is before the court with respect to Defense Motion to Modify Bail.  State advises they have no objection to the request to lift the no contact order with respect to Victims A-C and Witnesses A-D, but they are asking there be a no contact order with respect to Victim D and Witness E as it relates to the Amended Complaint that was filed back on 10/1.  Atty. McFadden acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea to the Amended Complaint filed on 10/1/22.  State would like to amend its initial statement, as she miss read the notes from the ADA assigned to the case.  State advises that the request is made by the Victims and Witnesses themselves, the State does not agree with lifting the no contact order.  Atty. McFadden presents additional statements.  Court confirms with the Victims and Witnesses present in court today that they are asking to have the no contact order be lifted.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail conditions as follows:  Court will lift the no contact order with respect to Victims A-C and Witnesses A-D, but court will add a no contact order with respect to Victim D and Witness E only.  All other conditions will remain as previously set.  Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. McFadden provides an update; he is still waiting for some digital discovery, and is ok with keeping the currently scheduled further proceedings set for 10/28.  State confirms several pieces of digital discovery were requested but their office has not received them yet.  Court will reschedule the 10/28/2022 hearing to middle of November to allow the State some addition time to work on obtaining the digital discovery.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Paul F Reilly October 7, 2022.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Conditions of Bond filed by Attorney Bryant J. McFadden
Filed by Atty. McFadden.
